title:
Polar Duality and Quasi-States: a Geometric Picture of Quantum
  Indeterminacy
abstract:
The aim of this paper is to suggest a new interpretation of quantum
indeterminacy using the notion of polar duality from convex geometry. Our
approach does not involve the usual variances and covariances, whose use to
describe quantum uncertainties has been questioned by Uffink and Hilgevoord. We
introduce instead the geometric notion of "quasi-states" which are related in a
way that will be explained to the notion of "quantum blob" we have introduced
in previous work. Considering the symmetries of the quasi-states leads to the
definition of the canonical group of a quasi-state, which allows to classify
them.
